com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveDocumentIf

All Superinterfaces:
Document, DocumentAS, DocumentTraversal, Node, XhiveLibraryChildIf, XhiveLockingContextIf, XhiveNodeIf
All Known Subinterfaces:
XhiveLinkBaseIf
public interface XhiveDocumentIf
extends XhiveLibraryChildIf, Document, DocumentAS, DocumentTraversal

Extends the Document interface to include additional X-Hive/DB properties.

The interface provides the following extensions to the Document interface:

  • Maintain document versions.

  • Access the security settings for the document.

  • Get and set the document description.

  • Get the document ID, creator, and last modification date.

  • Convert to an XML string.

The X-Hive/DB database stores DOM Document objects. To use the methods of the XhiveDocumentIf interface, obtain a Document object from a library, and cast this object to XhiveDocumentIf. For example, the following code obtains a long document ID for a document by casting it to a XhiveDocumentIf object:

long docId = ((XhiveDocumentIf)document).getId();

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Method Detail

createIDAttribute

Attr createIDAttribute(java.lang.String name)
                       throws DOMException
Special version of org.w3c.dom.Document:createAttribute, that creates an ID-attribute instead of a normal one. This is useful for getting entries in the ID-attribute index, without having to link a DTD to your document.

Returns:
A new Attr object with the nodeName attribute set to name, and localName, prefix, and namespaceURI set to null. The value of the attribute is the empty string.
Throws:
DOMException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
Document.createAttribute(java.lang.String)

createIDAttributeNS

Attr createIDAttributeNS(java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                         java.lang.String qualifiedName)
                         throws DOMException
Special version of org.w3c.dom.Document:createAttributeNS, that creates an ID-attribute instead of a normal one. This is useful for getting entries in the ID-attribute index, without having to link a DTD to your document.

Returns:
A new Attr object with the following attributes: AttributeValueNode.nodeNamequalifiedName Node.namespaceURInamespaceURI Node.prefixprefix, extracted from qualifiedName, or null if there is no prefixNode.localNamelocal name, extracted from qualifiedNameAttr.name qualifiedNameNode.nodeValuethe empty string
Throws:
DOMException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0
See Also:
Document.createAttributeNS(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

fixupDoctypeIds

boolean fixupDoctypeIds(java.lang.String catalogFolderName)
This method was introduced for enabling services like the X-Hive/DB DAV servlet to change the public and system ID of the document type of a document to match the actual location of the DTD in the catalog. This information is usually read-only.

But this method is no longer necessary, you can now cast DocumentType objects to XhiveDocumentTypeIf.

What this method does is (if there is a document type, which links to a DTD in the catalog):

  • Set the system id to 'catalogFolderName/FilenameOfsystemIDInCatalog'
  • If the public id of the DTD in the catalog is not set, set it to a value (this is no longer necessary as documents linked to a DTD will always have a public id set).

Parameters:
catalogFolderName - The name to use as folder name for the catalog
Returns:
true if correct information was set up, false if it did not work.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0.1
See Also:
XhiveDocumentTypeIf

setErrorHandler

void setErrorHandler(DOMErrorHandler errorHandler)
Deprecated. use DOMConfiguration::getDomConfig().setParameter("error-handler", ....); to set the errorhandler

This method is the equivalent of the DOM level 3 method setErrorHandler on Document.

This attribute allows applications to specify a DOMErrorHandler to be called in the event that an error is encountered while performing an operation on a document. Note that not all methods use this mechanism, see the description of each method for details.

Currently only the validation methods of abstract schema use these interfaces.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0 & DOM Level 3
See Also:
DocumentAS.validate()

normalizeDocument

void normalizeDocument()
This method acts as if the document was going through a save and load cycle, putting the document in a "normal" form. As a consequence, this method updates the replacement tree of EntityReference nodes and normalizes Text nodes, as defined in the method Node.normalize().
Otherwise, the actual result depends on the features being set on the Document.domConfig object and governing what operations actually take place. Noticeably this method could also make the document namespace well-formed according to the algorithm described in , check the character normalization, remove the CDATASection nodes, etc. See DOMConfiguration for details. 
// Keep in the document 
 the information defined // in the XML Information Set (Java example) 
 DOMConfiguration docConfig = myDocument.getDomConfig(); 
 docConfig.setParameter("infoset", Boolean.TRUE); 
 myDocument.normalizeDocument();

Mutation events, when supported, are generated to reflect the changes occurring on the document.
If errors occur during the invocation of this method, such as an attempt to update a read-only node or a Node.nodeName contains an invalid character according to the XML version in use, errors or warnings (DOMError.SEVERITY_ERROR or DOMError.SEVERITY_WARNING) will be reported using the DOMErrorHandler object associated with the "error-handler " parameter. Note this method might also report fatal errors ( DOMError.SEVERITY_FATAL_ERROR) if an implementation cannot recover from an error.

Specified by:
normalizeDocument in interface Document
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1 & DOM Level 3

getXmlVersion

java.lang.String getXmlVersion()
This method is the equivalent of the DOM level 3 method getXmlVersion on Document.

Specified by:
getXmlVersion in interface Document
Returns:
The XML version of the document as specified in the XML declaration or set by setXmlVersion(java.lang.String).
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.1 & DOM Level 3

setXmlVersion

void setXmlVersion(java.lang.String xmlVersion)
This method is the equivalent of the DOM level 3 method setXmlVersion on Document.

By default, documents created using DOMImplementation.createDocument(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.w3c.dom.DocumentType) have XML version 1.0. Setting the XML version to 1.1 allows usage of XML 1.1 allowed characters where applicable, e.g. in element and attribute names.

Specified by:
setXmlVersion in interface Document
Parameters:
xmlVersion - The XML version of the document.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.1 & DOM Level 3

validateDocument

boolean validateDocument()
Deprecated. Use Document.normalizeDocument() which allows revalidation against a linked DTD or XML Schema by setting the DOMConfiguration parameters.

Validates the document against the schema, e.g., a DTD or an W3C XML schema or another. This is a substitute for the removed org.w3c.dom.validation.DocumentEditVAL.validateDocument() method.

Returns:
Whether the document is valid.
